intro: Sphagneticola ulei, commonly known as African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade to full sun. Sphagneticola ulei is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant flower colors.
